locutie.beschrijving: Exegesis of Romans 12 focusing on the 'therefore' and the passive voice of transformation. The sermon uses the context of All Souls Day and a rector's institution to discuss the nature of sainthood as God's work.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. Strong focus on the 'passivum divinum' in the Greek text and the structural flow from Romans 1-11 into 12.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the priority of God's action over human will, while occasionally moving into promising the presence of that power today.
voorbeelden: God is the chief actor.
Saints are made in spite of themselves.
I appeal to you therefore...

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Relief from moralistic striving; trust in God's transformative power; recognition of God's agency in the hearer's life.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicit. The preacher emphasizes that the Spirit is the agent of the 'perlocution' (transformation).

voorbeelden: God is the subject of most of the sentences in the Bible.
Paul is describing the saints.
This is a description of you.
Listen to what Paul says.
Become what you already are!
Do not be conformed.
It is my great privilege.
I wish I could write it in flame.
I have never forgotten.
The promise of God is that this is exactly what God intends to do with us.
He can be trusted.
God intends to do a new thing.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong theological grounding, but often phrased as 'talking about' the promise rather than 'delivering' it directly.

voorbeelden: You are the saints.
It is even possible... today—because it is God’s doing.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher uses the authority of the text to redefine the identity of the congregation.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling about the mother in Virginia.
Long explanations of the 'therefore' and the sequence of Romans.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed about the mechanics of grace but remains an observer of the 'event' rather than the direct object of it.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer may feel 'God does this for others (Rosa Parks, the mother)' rather than 'God is doing this to me right now.'

voorbeelden: The promise of God is that this is exactly what God intends to do with us.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Talking about Paul, God, Rosa Parks, and the mother.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that requires a 'jump' to apply to the present moment.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about how God works.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The preacher explicitly avoids the 'Assertive -> Directive' trap by critiquing the hymn 'I mean to be one too'.
voorbeelden: Critique of the hymn's focus on 'I'.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God's plan) -> Commissive (God's promise) -> Directive (Walk in newness).
voorbeelden: God does it... The promise is... Walk in newness.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Theologically perfect, but the 'Declarative' link is the weakest part.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because this is so [Indicative], we need always to be mindful [Imperative].

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon succeeds in being sacramental because it makes God the acting subject, even if the language is heavily descriptive.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: God is the subject of most of the sentences in the Bible.
sterke_punten.effect: Shifts the focus from human effort to divine agency.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long story of the mother in Virginia.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The story is 'about' grace rather than being the 'delivery' of grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event when it declares 'You are the saints', but spends much time explaining why that is true.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher acts as a true 'mandataris' by insisting on God's work over human will.

openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, explicitly stated in the opening.
tekstueel_bewijs: It is my high calling... to bring the gospel message.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as the agent of transformation.
tekstueel_bewijs: By the power of the Holy Spirit... God creates a different kind of person.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is treated as the means through which God's 'therefore' reaches the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: The promise of God is that this is exactly what God intends to do with us.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'says' (Assertives). It needs more 'I promise' and 'You are' (Commissives/Declaratives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Paul is describing the saints. That is to say, it is a description of you.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus Christ, I declare that you are the saints of God.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a constative description to a declarative act.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often hidden in a story about someone else.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Address the congregation directly with the promise.
voorbeeldzinnen: God promises you today that He will renew your mind.
You are the ones God is transforming.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theological depth that avoids moralism. To reach the next level, move from 'talking about' God's power to 'exercising' it through more direct performative acts.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' in the stories; SAT focuses on the 'Divine Act' performed through the words.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric would praise the storytelling; SAT asks if the story actually 'does' something to the hearer's status before God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the preacher's critique of the hymn is itself a performative act of 'correcting' the hearer's theological stance.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a rare example of a preacher consciously fighting 'Constative Surplus' while still using many constatives to build the case.
